turns.speaker: LADY HAMPTON
turns.text: You should sit down, darling.  She's quite all right.  Are you pregnant?

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: I don't think so.

turns.speaker: LADY HAMPTON
turns.text: How romantic.  With Fiona I fell over every five minutes.  Ronnie Christened me Lady Downfall.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: I think I might go inside and sit down for a few minutes.

turns.speaker: LADY HAMPTON
turns.text: I'll come with you.

turns.speaker: KATHARINE
turns.text: No, please.  I shall be absolutely fine. They pass Alm√°sy, who doesn't look up from his book.

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: Brick platform opposite the old Ajaib-Gher -

turns.speaker: THE PATIENT
turns.text: - The Wonder House comma as the natives called the Lahore Museum.

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: It's still there, the cannon, outside the museum. It was made of metal cups and bowls taken from every household in the city as tax, then melted down. Then later they fired the cannon at my people - comma - The natives.

turns.speaker: THE PATIENT
turns.text: So what do you really object to - the writer or what he's writing about?

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: What I really object to, Uncle, is your finishing all my condensed milk.  And the message everywhere in your book - however slowly I read it - that the best destiny for India is to be ruled by the British.

turns.speaker: THE PATIENT
turns.text: Hana, we have discovered a shared please - the boy and I.

turns.speaker: THE PATIENT
turns.text: This is wonderful!

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: What's he saying?

turns.speaker: THE PATIENT
turns.text: Kip?

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: I looked up to you, Uncle.  My brother always said I was a fool. Never trust the British, he said: the deal-makers, the map-makers; never shake hands with them.

turns.speaker: THE PATIENT
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: What have I been doing all this time? Do you know how many mines I've seen? - more mines than there are soldiers, more - how many mines we've put in the ground ourselves, stuffed in corpses, dropped out of the sky.  And now this.

turns.speaker: KIP
turns.text: They're excited!  They're happy about destroying a whole city. Would they do that to a White Man's City?  Never!

turns.speaker: THE PATIENT
turns.text: Go on, do it.  I don't need to hear any more.

turns.speaker: OFFICER
turns.text: What about your rank or serial number?

turns.speaker: THE PATIENT
turns.text: No.  I think I was a pilot.  I was found near the wreckage of a plane by the Bedouin.  I was with them for some time.

turns.speaker: THE PATIENT
turns.text: Am I being interrogated?  You should be trying to trick me.  Ask me about Tottenham Hotspur.  Or Buckingham Palace. About Marmite - I was addicted.  Or make me speak German, which I can, by the way.

turns.speaker: OFFICER
turns.text: Why?  Are you German?

turns.speaker: THE PATIENT
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: OFFICER
turns.text: How do you know you're not German if you don't remember anything?

turns.speaker: THE PATIENT
turns.text: You tell me.  I remember a lot of things. I remember a garden, plunging down to the sea - the Devil's Chimney we called it - and there was a cottage at the bottom, right on the shore, nothing between you and France.

turns.speaker: OFFICER
turns.text: This was your garden?

turns.speaker: THE PATIENT
turns.text: Or my wife's.

turns.speaker: OFFICER
turns.text: Then you were married?

turns.speaker: THE PATIENT
turns.text: I think so.  Although I believe that to be true of a number of Germans. Might I have a glass of water?

turns.speaker: CRUZ
turns.text: Where were you? I called at 4:30 this morning.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: There are times when you don't answer the phone.

turns.speaker: CRUZ
turns.text: You didn't answer the beeper either.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: I hardly knew the guy. Why be impolite to strangers?

turns.speaker: CRUZ
turns.text: I don't recall authorizing you to have a personal life.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: I don't recall asking your permission.

turns.speaker: CRUZ
turns.text: A thief this good could handle the sensors in the rooms. What we don't get is how he effectuated his entry.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Through a window.

turns.speaker: CRUZ
turns.text: The windows don't open.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Entry through the doors or vents triggers instant alarm.

turns.speaker: CRUZ
turns.text: So he popped the pane?

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Bingo.

turns.speaker: CRUZ
turns.text: That's great if you're a computer. In the real world that pane weighs 200 pounds. The building's 600 feet high.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: He unscrewed the bolts, reset them on rollers, then slid the whole frame away. No more effort than it takes to vacuum a floor.

turns.speaker: CRUZ
turns.text: Interesting theory. Where's the proof?

turns.speaker: CRUZ
turns.text: You ordering chop suey again?

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Let a thousand flowers bloom. Chairman Mao.

turns.speaker: CRUZ
turns.text: Meaning--

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Meaning no one arranges calalilies like that. He left the window open when he came in. His only mistake.

turns.speaker: CRUZ
turns.text: And the draft blew over the flowers.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Put the bolts on that window under a scope, I'm betting you'll find wrench scratches on them.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Mac's signature.

turns.speaker: CRUZ
turns.text: Give me a break. Remember Manzini? When he stole Montezuma's scepter he left a Pepto Bismal bottle. The best ones always copy Mac.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: You're saying the thief wants us to think it's Mac but it's really not.

turns.speaker: CRUZ
turns.text: Exactly.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: They've never caught him before, what makes you think they'll catch him now?

turns.speaker: CRUZ
turns.text: You got a better idea?

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Yeah. Me.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: We've got to catch him in the act.

turns.speaker: CRUZ
turns.text: Why didn't I think of that?

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: It's not the thinking of it, it's the doing it.

turns.speaker: CRUZ
turns.text: With that computer--nobody better. Out there...it's different. You twisted your ankle stepping over a curb on Madison Avenue.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: I've been following this guy for years. I'm your best shot.

turns.speaker: CRUZ
turns.text: How would you approach him? Hello, Mr. MacDougal, I'm Gin, would you steal a painting with me?

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: I'd need an introduction. From someone he trusts. Someone who owes us a favor.

turns.speaker: CRUZ
turns.text: That's doable.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: And a target guaranteed to catch his interest.

turns.speaker: CRUZ
turns.text: Which you have in mind.

turns.speaker: CRUZ
turns.text: You don't call, you don't write.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: This was my first excuse to get away. I can't exactly use my cell phone.

turns.speaker: CRUZ
turns.text: Yeah yeah yeah. What's the status?

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: We're getting close.

turns.speaker: CRUZ
turns.text: How close?

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: I don't know, but close.

turns.speaker: CRUZ
turns.text: This is dangerous. I'm sending backup.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: You, want to blow the whole thing, go right ahead.

turns.speaker: CRUZ
turns.text: Don't overestimate yourself.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Look, trust me. I know what I'm doing.

turns.speaker: CRUZ
turns.text: Where are you at least?

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: I'll send you a postcard. Got to go.

turns.speaker: CRUZ
turns.text: Gin? Where the hell are you?

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: I'm in the middle.

turns.speaker: CRUZ
turns.text: In the middle? You've got the Mask, why don't we have him?

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: He's on to something bigger.

turns.speaker: CRUZ
turns.text: Listen to me. Whatever you're doing, stop. Pull out.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Too late now.

turns.speaker: CRUZ
turns.text: Tell me where you are, or just leave the line open so I can trace you.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: I'm going to get him, I promise you.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: I have a question...

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Who am I?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: That is of no interest.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Why are we speaking Chinese?

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Uh. I'm showing off.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: A billion people speak Chinese. Don't be too impressed with yourself. As for that scroll, I can resell it for double. In 30 minutes.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: No you can't.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: I can't?

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: It's sold.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: How about if I try humility.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: How about if you try disappearing.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Mr. MacDougal.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: You're like malaria. Once you get it, you can't get rid of it.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: I'm sorry about the scroll, but sometimes you have to lose to win.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Where did you hear that, one of those American talk shows?  Check, please.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: I don't want to waste your time.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Then don't.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: I have a proposal for you.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Believe me, if you weren't so tiresome, I'd have one for you.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Something of great value, something of such artistic and historic significance that only you could truly appreciate...

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: You have a car?

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Uh, yes.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Meet me in front. Five minutes.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Seems I am.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: I'll call an ambulance.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: It's nothing serious. I'll just run into that building. They'll have some sort of first aid kit.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: You disappeared.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: You seemed to be handling everything quite nicely.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Are you...okay?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: It was only a scratch. Far more damaging to my trousers than to me.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: That's good. Terrific.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: I don't care about the damned car. My luggage's been stolen.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: You're joking.  You can't trust anyone these days.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Yes. But they don't have a clue.  Why would anyone steal my luggage?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Maybe the thief thought you had something valuable. You are in the business, that's what Roki says.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Like I would have art in my suitcase.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Of course you wouldn't. The Rembrandt wouldn't fit.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Excuse me?

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: I've got something...

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: I sincerely hope so.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: You're not taking me seriously.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Oh, I'm taking you...quite seriously.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: I didn't expect you to be so...

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: So what?

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: So alive.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Do you mind?

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: You...you can't.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Of course I can. I have a note from mother.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: You're shaking. Are you nervous?

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: No. Why would I be?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Because you young Americans think the world began when you were born. You fall apart when you don't get your own way.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: I've got something for you.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Oh, that's quite all right. No charge.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: And I thought we were getting on so well.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: We were, we are, but this is perfect for you.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Not interested.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Are you under the impression that now I'm in some way obligated to you?

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Well, no...but...

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Good. I'll call the concierge. They can get you a new room, book your flight home, so forth.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: For God's sake.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: I'm sorry. This just means so much to me.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: The Empress Death Mask.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: The most important piece of Chinese art outside of China.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Somewhat better than that temple scroll you were bidding on.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: That old pirate Chiang Kai Shek personally took this to Taiwan when he was run out of China in 1949. Peking would dearly love to have this back...

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: I suspected it might be worthy of your interest.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: It's not for sale.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: So you've heard all those stories about me. Well, I can assure you they're not true. And if they were true, I've retired.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: But Roki said--

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Roki has a vivid imagination.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Besides, if I lacked certain ethical scruples about the ownership of property--which I do not--I wouldn't need a partner, much less a callow girl. I'd do it myself.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: You can't.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Oh?

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: It's only on exhibit at the Queen's Museum this month. Even if you could get into the museum, the Mask bas its own security system. A special, randomly programmed interval code.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: We going somewhere?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Possibly.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Maybe I should drive this time.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Maybe you should go buy yourself some clothes.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Very nice.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Not a word.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: You want me to pick up a painting?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Quite a good one. A Monet. Not major, but it is Giverney.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: I'm not here to run errands. I'm here for the Mask.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: If I can't trust you to pick up a painting, how can I trust you about the Mask?

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: It's a test.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: That's my girl.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Fine. What do I do?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: It's simple. You pick up the painting, you pay for it with this debit card.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: How much am I paying?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: I'm paying...one point five million and change. I hate round numbers.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: It's a fake.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Give him the card.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: But--

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Can you follow simple directions?

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: I'm telling you it's a forgery. The paint's still wet for God's sake.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Look on the back. What do you see?

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: A film case.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: That's what you're buying. Put it in your pocket.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: He says they turned the card down.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Damn, I knew I forgot something.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Not funny.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: What the hell do I do now?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Up to you. You could tell him the check is in the mail.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: What the hell was that?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Not bad. I didn't expect you to make it out.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: You what--?

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Motorcycle.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Got it.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: It's one way.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: We're only going one way.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: We're going to die, aren't we...

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: I'm not the one to ask...

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: What about your bags?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: I never carry...baggage.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Those are my clothes.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Certainly not mine. Come on.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: You stole my luggage? You--

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: I'm a thief. Sue me.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Where's my bag?

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: That's entrapment.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: No. Entrapment is what cops do to robbers.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: I don't believe this.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: What's your problem? I'm doing the job.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: What's my problem? You want a list?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: You really don't believe I'd take on a partner after all these years without a little...insurance?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Lose something?

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: I'm just curious what sort of security system you'd have in your own house.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: And--

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: I'm impressed. Can't spot a thing.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Hmmm. I'd be surprised if you could.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Nothing? You don't even lock the door?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: I guess I have a more optimistic view of human nature than you do.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Why are we in separate--you know, separate rooms?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: My job, my rules. We've got a job to do. No mixing business and pleasure.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: You're late.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: <u>I'm</u> dressed.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: And good morning.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Good morning.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Nice spot.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: It is.  Coffee and fruitloops or whatever you eat in the kitchen. We'll start in twenty minutes.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: I know it well.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: As I recall, you've robbed it before.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Years ago, if memory serves. When does the exhibit end?

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: In a week.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Only a week?

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: They're having a farewell party the last night. Before the Mask goes back to Taiwan.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: That's when we'll do it. And we'll need every single day.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: So the Duke dug a tunnel--just in case. They made the lake a hundred years later. Flooded the tunnel.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: We go underwater?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: We? Are you implying that I'm taking you inside?

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: We're doing this together. We're partners.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Precisely. You give me the Mask security code, I steal the Mask, you get a finders fee. At ten percent, should be two or three million at least. Not too bad.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: I go in alone.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: You don't get the Mask code unless I go.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Pack up. I'll see you get back to London.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Look, I can help. You need a sensor expert. You've got one.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: This isn't some Picasso print you steal out of a car dealer's rec room.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: You don't have any idea how lucky you are!

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: A lifelong problem, I'm afraid.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: No, dammit! I mean me! That Rembrandt...that Rembrandt!

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Nice try. Everyone thinks I did.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: That's because I wanted them to!

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: I wondered who'd been giving me a bad name.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: I drilled the bolts and went in through the window. It was the only way to bypass the smart glass.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: True enough.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: You need a partner for this job. You'll never find one as good as me.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: The Rembrandt--that was quite good.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: It was perfect.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Someone was expecting that.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: You're too easily impressed with yourself. I believe I've made that point before.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: I'll need that.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: No one <u>needs</u> anything except food and shelter. The rest we just want.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: This isn't a good time to hear your personal philosophy.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Don't worry, I can get rid of this. No trace. And I'll even go fifty fifty, we're partners aren't we?

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: No. It's a down payment.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: On what? Another job?

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: We get the Mask I'll tell you.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: A partner with secrets isn't much of a partner.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Without the Mask it doesn't matter.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: So the Mask is part of the down payment too. Must be a really big job.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Let's just see how we do.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: So you're testing <u>me</u> now?

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Oh, I think you can do it. Probably.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Why don't we take oxygen?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: We are...for the tools.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Let's do it again.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Try laps. Say a hundred.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Did I hear a car?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Our equipment has arrived.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Hmmm.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: All this, this is a woman's version of what you would like.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: It was a long time ago.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: I didn't mean to get personal.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Yes you did.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: So how long to pop the floor?

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Twenty four seconds--as long as it takes the clock to strike twelve.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: And you've checked the ram to be sure it's synchronized with the clock.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: A dozen times.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: The lipstick thermal camera?

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Got it.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Charged?

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Charged. Receiver?

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: That's it. We're ready.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: One more item--not on the check list.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: I trust it's your size.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: It's---beautiful.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: You bought this for me?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Don't get any ideas. Of course it comes out of your share.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: No, no, I want to. I'll just go into the village.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: It's not a village. There's nothing there.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Won't take any time.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Straight down the drive, right at the hedgerow, follow the lane. Don't blink, you'll miss it.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Certainly the most beautiful crook I've ever seen.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: I've got something for you.

turns.speaker: GIN
turns.text: Aren't we early?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Little celebration before we set off.
